body:
Lyanna I Preview

“A Wolf Apart”

An anon put an ask for a preview in my inbox and look, I just posted the last chapter three days ago! Also I tried to post the ask on the mobile app and well I’m a goddamned disaster.

But since I’m not used to people actually looking for my work I will honor your absurd request, anon because I secretly love you.

Im at like 2800 words in this and it’s moving along nicely. When will it be posted? I dunno. Maybe another two weeks and change?

THIS IS LIKE INSANELY UNBETA’D AND MIGHT CHANGE.

“To crown someone is to kill them,” the knight muttered softly. “Queen Rhaella is fond of saying, at least.”

“My mother is the wisest person I know, Arthur. And the bravest.” A shadow crossed the Prince’s face for a moment, then left as suddenly as it had appeared, “Well, save for this lady here, mayhaps.”

“Lady Lyanna is…fierce,” Ser Arthur admitted.

Lyanna chuckled at that. “This arse crowned me,” she pointed across the fire to Prince Rhaegar, “Ser Arthur. Did he kill me?”

Rhaegar and Arthur stared at each other in shock before the Sword or the Morning started chuckling. “Did you just call the Crown Prince an ‘arse’, my lady?” Ser Arthur’s face was full of mirth. Rhaegar’s was more guarded, his beautiful features giving nothing away, but Lyanna saw the twinkle in his eyes. She smiled brightly at his question, feeling lighter than she had in days.

“Aye, I did, Ser Arthur. I always try and tell the truth.”

The Knight smiled at her before looking at Prince Rhaegar. “I reckon you’re right, my lady. He can be an arse.” They were all smiling now. Even Prince Rhaegar had one, a small and weak one, but a smile, nonetheless. Lyanna wondered how beautiful he would look with an actual smile on his face.

“It’s quite a conundrum, my good Ser. He’s both an arse and a pain in the arse. A rare thing.”

They all exploded in laughter. Even her moody Prince.

Finally, he smiled. Truly and brightly. It was one of the more gorgeous things Lyanna had ever seen. The way it reached his eyes, turning his purple eyes into precious gems, thrilled her. She found herself wanting to drown in them, to act a fool for the rest of her life it meant seeing those eyes shining like that.

The realization dawned on her amidst the laughter. She loved him. Rhaegar Targaryen. The married Crown Prince of Westeros. She was truly fucked.

As if he could sense her thoughts, Rhaegar’s laughter died quickly, his broody scowl snapping back into place. He was staring at her, through her it seemed with those eyes, darker now. “Perhaps I have, my lady.” The sadness in his voice wiped the smile off her face, replaced with confusion.

“Killed you, that is.”

A stunned silence took hold of her. Ser Arthur had the manners to look away, Dawn on his lap, cleaning it with an oiled rag. Lyanna stared at Rhaegar, tried to see his meaning but she could find none. No sign of mirth was evident. The moment between them stretched on and on. Until Lyanna could take no more and reached next to her, grabbed a big pebble and hurled it at his head.

“Ow,” he said as he reached for the top of his head. He rubbed his hand across it, checking for blood. “What was that?”

“There, my Prince,” she said with as much scorn as she could muster. “Now I’ve crowned you. Have I killed you?”

He looked at her, hand on his head and the smile reappeared. The slight one, stiff and sad. Lyanna though, would take whatever he gave her. She wanted to kiss him, there, on the corner of his mouth, just below the dimple that formed with his smile.

“Valar Morghulis,” he muttered.

summary:
Daenerys Targaryen and relatives of people who overthrew her family
ʼThey said Robert Baratheon was strong as a bull and...
body:
Daenerys Targaryen and relatives of people who overthrew her family

ʼThey said Robert Baratheon was strong as a bull and fearless in battle, a man who loved nothing better than war. And with him stood the great lords her brother had named the Usurper’s dogs, cold-eyed Eddard Stark with his frozen heart, and the golden Lannisters, father and son, so rich, so powerful, so treacherousʼ.

- Daenerys, A Clash of Kings

summary: This is what I know: There have been a lot of redheads so far in Jon Snow’s life:  Tormond, Robb, Ygritte, Lady Melisandre, and...
body:
This is what I know:

There have been a lot of redheads so far in Jon Snow’s life: 

Tormond, Robb, Ygritte, Lady Melisandre, and of course… Sansa!

Red hair isn’t particularly predominant.

It’s FORSHADOWING something. In my opinion.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: It’s a bit weird considering the original romance that GRRM planned between Jon and Arya, but it’s interesting that Gendry is...
body:
It’s a bit weird considering the original romance that GRRM planned between Jon and Arya, but it’s interesting that Gendry is Robert’s son and Jon is Rhaegar’s son and Arya is a Lyanna clone in the books - everyone compares Arya to Lyanna and Bran even mistakes his vision of Lyanna as being Arya.

Anyways looks like Bobby B’s son is now in love with Lyanna clone Arya. But thankfully, Jon and Arya’s love seems to be purely sibling love this time around. So no love triangle that leads to war.

“Protect Dany”
“She is out hope”
And delusional people think tgat Sam...
body:
Last comands and words of Aemon Targaryen to Samwell Tarly

“Protect Dany”

“She is out hope”

And delusional people think tgat Sam forgets his true father’s words and protect his criminal father Rendil Tarly and his “Dick”on brother who took his place in Horn Hill with pleasure?

🤣

Sam wasn’t the men who gifted his family sword two unknown person? Sword what is the biggest worth of Westeros houses? This sword was proud of his father. It means how Rendil means nothing to Sam👌🏿

blog.title: Fiction consumes me and reality is a distant dream

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Jonerys is not even a favourite GOT ship of mine and it wouldn't really bother me if Jonerys didn't somehow work out in season...
body:
Jonerys is not even a favourite GOT ship of mine and it wouldn’t really bother me if Jonerys didn’t somehow work out in season 8. However I think it does bother me that a certain group of people feel the need to antagonize and scrape the bottom of the barrel in twisting a character all because she stands in the way of their ship. You never see Jonerys or Gendrya stans so passionately spew hate/write biased metas about another character because it threatens their ship. If a ship heavily relies on you butchering another character and holding her to a double standard compared to everyone else then you’re building on quicksand. Especially when some of said ship shout “sexism” and “misogyny” in defence.

It’s sexism and misogyny to antagonize another female character solely because she is in the way of your fav getting to bang someone.

summary:
I’ve always had a soft spot for the outsider, for the underdog. 
‘Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things’, as the title of one of...
body:
I’ve always had a soft spot for the outsider, for the underdog. ‘Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things’, as the title of one of the (TV series) episodes goes. The angst that they have in life makes for more conflict, makes for more drama, and there’s something very attractive about that. My Game of Thrones is told by outsiders of both types. None of them fit comfortably into the society into which they’ve been born, and they’re all struggling to find a place for themselves in which they’re valued and loved and respected, despite what their society considers their deficiencies. And out of that, I think, comes good stories. - GRRM

https://www.buzzfeed.com/danieldalton/purple-socks#221x6x5

Five central characters will make it through all three volumes, however, growing from children to adults and changing the world and themselves in the process. In a sense, my trilogy is almost a generational saga, telling the life stories of these five characters, three men and two women. The five key players are Tyrion Lannister, Daenerys Targaryen, and three of the children of Winterfell, Arya, Bran, and the bastard Jon Snow. All of them are introduced at some length in the chapters you have to hand.

https://www.thisisinsider.com/game-of-thrones-original-story-2017-8

At the end of day, this series is about the outcasts and underdogs of society rising above society’s opinions and views on them and becoming something better and bigger. It is about Jon Snow being a good person despite society thinking that bastards are black hearted and of wanton nature because they are born of lust. It’s about Bran saving the world despite being a cripple who can no longer be a knight or fight. It’s about Arya being a good leader and possibly finding love and happiness despite not conforming to society’s views and expectations on how a proper lady should be. It’s about the exiled princess  Dany finding a home with the red door and defying society’s expectations about how she will be exactly like her father. It’s about the deformed imp being a good, tactical strategist and hand and being more capable of managing power than either of his perfectly formed siblings.

It’s a generational saga about how these characters prove society was wrong about them and how they rise from being the underdogs to a position of power to save the world.

GRRM’s story is not about Dany proving that Westeros society was right about her and she is going to become exactly like her dad. It’s not about how Westeros society was right about Jon and he is indeed deceitful manipulating a woman by seducing her. It’s not about how Arya is only good for killing because she is not a proper lady. It’s not about how Bran is an emotionless robot useful only for exposition about the past. It’s not about Tyrion failing and never getting any love and respect because he is deformed and an imp.

If that’s what GRRM is heading towards and his message is that these characters can never rise above their birth and will prove that the bigoted Westeros society was right about them, then that’s ultimately a very nihilistic tale with no moral message and is the complete opposite of Tolkein’s Lord of the Rings.

blog.title: Brandon

summary:
Especially in bed!
Daario?! 
That man was laying the pipe of his life and Daenerys was holding a straight conversation with him...
body:
Jon Snow is better than Daario Naharis

Especially in bed!


Daario?!

That man was laying the pipe of his life and Daenerys was holding a straight conversation with him as if they were drinking tea.


Jon?!

I can bet you any sorts of money that if you told Daenerys “Your grace, if you can form any single sentence. Anything. Doesn’t matter what it is. You will have everything you ever desired” and she wouldn’t say shit. That woman was getting her brains fucked out of her as soon as Jon hit that first thrust.


You see the way she’s kissing him? Not letting him break away? That’s the move girls pull when they’re getting fucked good and don’t want anyone around them to hear.

You see the way she caresses his face and then moves it to his chest? She wants as much contact as possible. Daario could never.

Crazy part? Jon wasn’t even hitting maximum overdrive.
